issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Attempts to use mapred hsadmin fail on a secure cluster for a couple of reasons. The HSAdmin client isn't configuring the principal config key for the protocol, resulting in a "Failed to specify server's Kerberos principal name" error.  The principal can be specified manually on the command-line via -Dhadoop.security.service.user.name.key, but then it results in a "Protocol interface ... is not known" error because HSAdminServer is not registering an appropriately configured policy provider when authorization is enabled.
fields.summary: mapred hsadmin fails on a secure cluster

comments.body: Patch that has the server refresh the protocol acls with the policy provider and has the client set the principal config key.  Needed to move the protocol interfaces to mapreduce-common so they are visible by the existing history server policy provider.
